Class FutoshikiPuzzle

java.lang.Object
  FutoshikiPuzzle

public class FutoshikiPuzzle
extends Object

Game of FutoshikiPuzzle that holds values of each square, constrains and means to edit them.

Version:
1.2
Author:
Radek Lochman

fillFirstPuzzle

public void fillFirstPuzzle()
Create predefined puzzle

fillPuzzle

public void fillPuzzle(int fillNum)
Creates a random number of occurences to fill some fields, and/or constraints. 0 will empty the puzzle.

Parameters:
fillNum - A number of random constraints and/or numbers to be pre-filled

findEmpty

public FutoshikiSquare findEmpty()
search grid for and square that is empty (square with value 0)

Returns:
A FutoshikiSquare object with value 0

                     int b)
Get value of FutoshikiSquare

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
Check if there is any empty square (square with value of 0) in current grid. If there is none, it check if there is any problem with current grid If there is none, it returns true, false otherwise

Returns:
true if grid is full and legal, false otherwise

isLegal

public boolean isLegal()
Returns true if there are no violations of constraints and no repeating numbers in rows or columns

Returns:
False if there is more than one number of same value in row or column, or if any of the constraints were violated, true otherwise

loadGame

public void loadGame()
Load last saved game from the text file

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Main method for FutoshikiPuzzle

Parameters:
args - First number you type in will determine size of grid, second will specify number of pre-filled numbers and/or constraints For example type 5 and 7 to get 5x5 grid with 7 pre-filled numbers and/or constraints

printPuzzle

public void printPuzzle()
Prints out the puzzle

restoreBackup

public void restoreBackup()
Restore grid from the gameBackup

saveGame

public void saveGame()
Save current state of the game to a text file

setColumnConstraint

public void setColumnConstraint(int a,
                                int b,
                                String item)
Assigns a sign to constraint with coordinates [a][b]

Parameters:
a - A row number
b - A column number
item - A sign that goes between squares [a][b] and [a][b+1]

setRowConstraint

public void setRowConstraint(int a,
                             int b,
                             String item)
Assigns a sign to constraint with coordinates [a][b]

Parameters:
a - A row number
b - A column number
item - A sign that goes between squares [a][b] and [a][b+1]

setShowProblems

public void setShowProblems(boolean a)
Set a value for ShowProblems

Parameters:
a - A boolean value for ShowProblems

setSquare

public void setSquare(int a,
                      int b,
                      int item)
Assigns a value to square at coordinates [a][b]. Enter 0 to delete the value of square

Parameters:
a - A row number
b - A column number
item - An integer to put in the array

showComplete

public void showComplete()
Check if the grid is complete, if yes then change background colour of each FutoshikiSquare to green

solve

public boolean solve()
Recursive method that attemps to solve the current state of FutoshikiPuzzle by finding first empty field, increase its value, and run itself again, if it comes back false, increase value again and so on.

Returns:
Returns False if current game is already not Legal or unsolvable, returns True when solved.

validColumn

public boolean validColumn(int whichColumn)
Returns true if there are no invalid or repeating numbers in specified column

Parameters:
whichColumn - Number of column to be checked
Returns:
False if there is more than one number of same value in column, True otherwise

validRow

public boolean validRow(int whichRow)
Returns true if there are no invalid or repeating numbers in specified row

Parameters:
whichRow - Number of column to be checked
Returns:
False if there is more than one number of same value in row, True otherwise

validSquare

public boolean validSquare(int R,
                           int C)
Check validity of one square by checking if the same value is repeated in any other square in the same row or column

Returns:
Return false if the value of square is repeated in the same row or column, return true otherwise
